com.artemis

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.artemis.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    The primary instance for the framework.

    It contains all the managers. You must use this to create, delete and retrieve entities. It is also important to set the delta each game loop iteration, and initialize before game loop.

    Author:
    Arni Arent

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World()
        Creates a new world.

        An EntityManager and ComponentManager are created and added upon creation.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Makes sure all managers systems are initialized in the order they were added.

        Returns a manager that takes care of all the entities in the world.
        Returns:
        entity manager

      • getComponentManager

        public ComponentManager getComponentManager()
        Returns a manager that takes care of all the components in the world.
        Returns:
        component manager

      • setManager

        public final <T extends Manager> T setManager(T manager)
        Add a manager into this world.

        It can be retrieved later. World will notify this manager of changes to entity.

        Type Parameters:
        T - class type of the manager
        Parameters:
        manager - manager to be added
        Returns:
        the manager

      • setDelta

        public void setDelta(float delta)

        Parameters:

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity(Entity e)
        Adds a entity to this world.
        Parameters:
        e - the entity to add

      • changedEntity

        public void changedEntity(Entity e)
        Ensure all systems are notified of changes to this entity.

        If you're adding a component to an entity after it's been added to the world, then you need to invoke this method.

        Parameters:
        e - the changed entity

      • deleteEntity

        public void deleteEntity(Entity e)
        Delete the entity from the world.
        Parameters:
        e - the entity to delete

      • enable

        public void enable(Entity e)
        (Re)enable the entity in the world, after it having being disabled.

        Won't do anything unless it was already disabled.

        Parameters:
        e - the entity to enable

      • disable

        public void disable(Entity e)
        Disable the entity from being processed.

        Won't delete it, it will continue to exist but won't get processed.

        Parameters:
        e - the entity to disable

      • createEntity

        public Entity createEntity()
        Create and return a new or reused entity instance.

        Will NOT add the entity to the world, use addEntity(Entity) for that.

        Returns:
        entity

      • getEntity

        public Entity getEntity(int entityId)
        Get a entity having the specified id.
        Parameters:
        entityId - the entities id
        Returns:
        the specific entity

      • getSystems

        public ImmutableBag<EntitySystem> getSystems()
        Gives you all the systems in this world for possible iteration.
        Returns:
        all entity systems in world

      • setSystem

        public <T extends EntitySystem> T setSystem(T system)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setSystem

        public <T extends EntitySystem> T setSystem(T system,
                                   boolean passive)
        Will add a system to this world.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the system class type
        Parameters:
        system - the system to add
        passive - wether or not this system will be processed by process()
        Returns:
        the added system
